Posts.Content: Hi Dansta, I really struggled with nausea after EC 1&2, nothing was working and could barely eat/drink and because of that I felt very weak & lethargic. My oncologist switched me to 6mg of levomepromazine which has worked amazingly, made my 3&4th EC far more bearable. Will make you sleep though xx
Posts.Title: Chemotherapy side effects

Posts.Content: Shut not shit!!! Hahaha!!!
Posts.Title: Fluoxetine (Prozac) to reduce hot flushes...

Posts.Content: Hello, I'm on tamoxifen yet, I'm having chemo surgery & radiotherapy first. I have also read that it was interfere with T so even if I do take it it will be short term. Not sure if it's worth it X
Posts.Title: Fluoxetine (Prozac) to reduce hot flushes...

Posts.Content: Hello all,  So since having a prostap 3 injection to shit down my ovaries as part of my fertility preservation I have suffered terribly with the dreaded hot flushes...grrrr I hate them!!!!  So I went to my gp to see if there's anything we can do, he's prescribed me Fluoxetine. I know this is an anti depressant, but I am not depresssed. Has anyone also taken Fluoxetine for flushes? How did it effect you? Did it stop the flushes? Any mood change? I'm trying to weigh up the pros and cons before I start.  Thanks! Xx
Posts.Title: Fluoxetine (Prozac) to reduce hot flushes...

Posts.Content: That's bad that it might have detrimental effects on the docetaxol I'm having, I swear you have to be really on the ball when going through treatment, there have been so many occasions where things either haven't been done, or done properly and luckily I've realised and pulled them up. From IVF options, to my fertility preservation injections, to anti-sickness dosage and now this..scary.  Thanks for the feedback guys x Mistymoley you made me giggle
Posts.Title: Fluoxetine (Prozac) to reduce hot flushes...

Posts.Content: Daktarin oral gel was an absolute lifesaver for me! My mouth would go very slimey, then gritty and very very sore. It was the only thing which worked for me, perhaps worth a shot if nothing else works  xx
Posts.Title: Oh my mouth...

Posts.Content: Take polish off your toes too for surgery, I removed my gels for the op but afterwards they said I should of taken it off my toes too as they check the colour / blood flow or something x
Posts.Title: Acrylic nails

Posts.Content: Hi Sal44! Im in the same boat, I'm 30 and haven't had a family yet. I also did fertility presavation before chemo, we managed to freeze 2 embryos, but the sats of achieving a successful pregnancy from 2 still worries me. I was told by the fertility doctor to go back 9 months after chemo and they will run some tests and examinations to reassess my fertility. Perhaps you could do that so you know where you stand?  I will also start on tamoxifen in a few weeks, I was told by my oncologist to wait 5 years, but the fertility dr said I could take a break after a couple of years. Not sure where I stand so I will have to investigate further later in the year. I think that after 5 years your chances of recurrence reduces significantly. I know what you mean about feeling selfish for potentially having children when my future is uncertain, it's a tough one. I guess we can't live on 'what ifs', I intend to get back to normal life after my treatment and children were always in our plan, so I'm sure we will try.  What will be will be, even if I don't manage to have a family of my own I know that as long as I'm alive I will have a wonderful fulfilled life   I'm friends with a few gay couples in their 30s and 40s who don't have kids and their lives are no worse off without them. In fact their livestyles are in some ways more appealing than my other friends with children ha!  I'd be interested to know how you get on, all the best of luck xxx
Posts.Title: Taking a break from tamoxifen for children

Posts.Content: Sorry I've just seen JeanieBs comment which says the same! Silly me x
Posts.Title: Acrylic nails

Posts.Content: Hey Shirl3, I was also prescribed fluoxetine however following research found out that it can actually counter act tamoxifen, I went back and got a different kind. My GP had no idea! I have no idea if you are on / will be on tamoxifen, just thought it was worth mentioning just in case :)  x Shirl3
Posts.Title: Help with hot flushes

Posts.Content: Sounds like oral thrush to me, I had it during chemo, its delightful!  Dektarin oral gel is amazing & worth a try, it's all that worked for me, strong mouthwashes just burnt my mouth. It happened to me about 3 days after each cycle & wouldn't clear up without the gel. I cant help re. feet or bum sorry! Well done for keeping positive, I thought I'd got a raw deal being diagnosed at 30, 26 is a real kick in the teeth! Scary how common its becoming amongst younger ladies now :( keep strong, you can do it! x
Posts.Title: FEC side effect remedies needed please!!!!

Posts.Content: Has anyone tried the magnet thing? i'm interested to know if that has helped anyone. I think mine are in my head sometimes, I will think to myself 'oo I've got had a hot flush in ages' and then have one seconds later!  Venlafaxine works well, mine have reduced in frequency and intensity x
Posts.Title: Help with hot flushes

Posts.Content: How unfair  he's said that it would be of real benefit for me for a few reasons while I'm in a chemically endused menopause. Firstly to protect me from secondary cancer, and secondly to strengthen my bones to prevent weekening from the tamoxifen. £800 was the cheapest option at the Alexandra in Manchester, the Christie clinic was double that!!  He's written a letter to my gp to see if we can give me the tablet form on the NHS, it's unlikely as in my area they aren't allowed to prescribe it for prevention of recurrence from early EC, so it would have to be a private prescription or something  I'm 30, I just want to do everything I can to protect myself x
Posts.Title: Zoledronic Acid

Posts.Content: YES!  this has been a huge problem for me, and every time i ask the drs they don't really have an answer. after starting Docetaxol i developed open sores which just wont heal. I finished chemo in Feb and its now worse than ever! i'm on herceptin until next month, so i'm thinking it could be that. i'm reallllly hoping it sorts itself out once I've finished herceptin. The herceptin runny nose doesn't help, and stings The things that help me a bit, a nasal salt spray called sanimar from boots to help keep it clean, and naseptin cream from the drs (prescription only) helps a bit too x
Posts.Title: Nose sores!!

Posts.Content: update...I've continued with the sudocrem and its worked fantastically, I'm so pleased  good for spots too!
Posts.Title: Nose sores!!

Posts.Content: Yeah it's a private hospital. I'm being treated at the Christie on the NHS but my oncologist said that because the injection isn't available on the NHS for me I'd have have to go privately to the Alex. He does mainly private work so he'd do it just not at the Christie x
Posts.Title: Zoledronic Acid

Posts.Content: My oncologist has recommended that I have those 6 monthly injections of zoledronic acid to protect my bones, but has said they're not on the NHS, do you guys pay privately? I hope you mind me asking, I'm currently trying to find £800 to have the injection
Posts.Title: Zoledronic Acid

Posts.Content: Good idea, I will book in with my gp next week. He's really amazing so I'm sure he will try to help me as much as possible. Thank you for your input everyone
Posts.Title: Zoledronic Acid

Posts.Content: So interesting to hear of others with a sore nose while on herceptin! roll on my final injection! x
Posts.Title: Nose sores!!

Posts.Content: I might have found the answer!!!!!! SUDOCREM!!! I've been using for only a couple of days now and it really is feeling better. There are still open sores, but the waterproof cream feels like its protecting them. It's stopping it getting so dry too   anything's worth a try right! x
Posts.Title: Nose sores!!

Posts.Content: I'm off to lanzarote next week (wahooooo!) should I stop taking my tamoxifen? Or just hydrate / wear my surgery stockings? I know the guidelines are just are to stop taking for long haul, but it's only 4ish hours
Posts.Title: Flying while on tamoxifen

Posts.Content: Dark gels, but if you don't feel comfortable with gels anymore I'd go for a dark varnish, sally Hanson ones are good, and i think the best top coat is RapidDry by OPI, bit more expensive but worth it. Maybe try a nourishing bottom coat too if they're dry.  Defo get a good cuticle oil though, it will help with the regrowth, I use gelish nourish it's fab and smells great x
Posts.Title: Nail care

Posts.Content: Hi Jane! I also have gel nails, my partner bought me a home kit for my Xmas present! Apparently the natural UV rays penetrating the nail can make them weak so I'm keeping mine covered with dark colours. I keep them short & the cuticles well moisturised with oil. Trim off weak bits rather than letting them snap    I hope everything is going well with your treatment   x
Posts.Title: Nail care

Posts.Content: Hi Tia, Always best to get these things checked out by the pros. Mine was hard and attached to the surrounding tissue. I think GPs refer on to the breast clinic for most breast lumps.  It's very likely yours will be a cyst, try not to worry  x
Posts.Title: What did your lump feel like?

Posts.Content: T is no where near as bad, I had x4 EC and now I've had 2/4 tax. I really struggled with nausea and generally feeling horrible for a week after EC, but tax is very different. More aches/pains, sore nose and sore mouth..but far more bearable xx
Posts.Title: Fec cycle 2 feeling terrible (sorry)

Posts.Content: Maybe try the Lucozade Zero if you're worried about the amount of sugar. When I was feeling crap after chemo I ate and drank whatever made me feel better, regardless of the nutritional values. Then once feeling better reverted back to healthy eating :) I had a taste for bacon butties and strawberry milkshakes! x
Posts.Title: Can i drink lucozade on chemo

Posts.Content: Hi Sacha, I had 8 cycles and lost half of my hair, mainly on the top and and around the edges where the cap missed. I'm now 7 months post-chemo and its so thick! it soon fills out, the new hair is about 3 inches, and I'm keeping a short bob until it catches up with the rest. I used to be paranoid that people could tell, but looking back at pictures you would never have guessed I was going though treatment. Don't loose heart! you've done so well...and your last chemo today is cause for celebration!! well done :)
Posts.Title: Hair or no hair ,

Posts.Content: Hi Maxine A few months before diagnosis I would be hit with sudden tiredness mid afternoon at work, I thought I was just being a lazy sod but I think it was body telling me something. I would sit in the loo at work and have a mini nap for 10 mins! I'm 30!! Not normal!  Also, I had lots of tiny little spots / blisters on my chest and back which is very unusual for me, it was as if my body was toxic. Since treatment both have gone.  I have learnt to listen to my body, it's so important to know what's 'normal', isn't it x
Posts.Title: Feeling old and tired before diagnosis.

Posts.Content: Fantastic news!!!!!! X
Posts.Title: biopsy results

Posts.Content: Yes! It's awful isn't it!!! So sore and dry, I've tried all sorts..Vaseline, savlon, moisturiser, even  lip balm!! Savlon helped a bit, still sore though. Everyone at work must think I'm a right scruff with my fingers constantly up my nose. I'm trying hard not to pick. I think it's a docetaxol thing, as if was fine on EC. My final cycle is on Friday so I'm looking forward to my nose healing from then on  x
Posts.Title: Sore nose
